citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid relatedness between serogroups and serovars in the family Leptospiroceae with proposals for seven new Leptospira species.

p.s: Description of Leptospira meyeri sp. nov.

Leptospira meyeri (mey' er. i. N.L. gen. n. meyeri to honor Karl F. Meyer, the veterinarian who established veterinary public health in the United States through his broad interests in the zoonoses, including leptospirosis)
Leptospira meyeri does not grow at 11°C but does grow at 37°C.
Growth occurs in the presence of either 8-azaguanine (225 μg/ml), 2,6-diaminopurine (10 μg/ml), or copper sulfate (100 ppm).
It contains serovars from serogroups Ranarum and Semaranga (serovar semaranga).

The type strain, strain Iowa City Frog (= ATCC 43287) is a member of serogroup Ranarum and serovar ranarum and was isolated from the kidneys of a leopard frog (Rana pipiens) in the United States by S.
Diesch et al. (4); it has a G+C content of 33.5 ± 0.2 mol%.
